verses.verse: To the chief<WH5329> Musician<WH5329> on Neginoth,<WH5058> A Psalm<WH4210> of David.<WH1732> Hear<WH6030> me when I call,<WH7121> O God<WH430> of my righteousness:<WH6664> you have enlarged<WH7337> me when I was in distress;<WH6862> have mercy<WH2603> on me, and hear<WH8085> my prayer.<WH8605>

O you sons<WH1121> of men,<WH376> how<WH5704> long<WH5704> will you turn my glory<WH3519> into shame?<WH3639> how long will you love<WH157> vanity,<WH7385> and seek<WH1245> after leasing?<WH3577> Selah.<WH5542>
But know<WH3045> that the LORD<WH3068> has set<WH6395> apart<WH6395> him that is godly<WH2623> for himself: the LORD<WH3068> will hear<WH8085> when I call<WH7121> to him.
Stand in awe,<WH7264> and sin<WH2398> not: commune<WH559> with your own heart<WH3824> on your bed,<WH4904> and be still.<WH1826> Selah.<WH5542>
Offer<WH2076> the sacrifices<WH2077> of righteousness,<WH6664> and put your trust<WH982> in the LORD.<WH3068>
There be many<WH7227> that say,<WH559> Who<WH4310> will show<WH7200> us any good?<WH2896> LORD,<WH3068> lift<WH5375> you up the light<WH216> of your countenance<WH6440> on us.
You have put<WH5414> gladness<WH8057> in my heart,<WH3820> more than in the time<WH6256> that their corn<WH1715> and their wine<WH8492> increased.<WH7231>
I will both<WH3162> lay<WH7901> me down<WH7901> in peace,<WH7965> and sleep:<WH3462> for you, LORD,<WH3068> only<WH910> make me dwell<WH3427> in safety.<WH983>
